info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 04 at 4:11PM AST until January 06 at 6:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 8 to 10 feet. * WHERE...North-facing beaches of Puerto Rico, Vieques, and Saint John, as well as beaches of northern and western Saint Thomas, northern and eastern Saint Croix, and all beaches of Culebra. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
